info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 2:28PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Winter weather will continue through Wednesday... Winter-like conditions will remain over Nevada. Snow showers, including light, accumulating snow in valleys, will be around through mid-week along with colder temperatures. Model simulations continue to suggest an area of enhanced snowfall across eastern White Pine county through tonight. Most valleys and roadways will see less than an inch of additional accumulation through this evening. However, localized areas along higher passes like Sacramento Pass could see up to two inches of additional accumulation and Great Basin National Park could see an additional one to two inches through tonight. More snow is expected tomorrow across most of central and eastern Nevada Tuesday morning. Snow will start in Lander County where up to three inches in some higher elevations are expected. Snow showers will expand across the remainder of central and northern Nevada in the afternoon where valley snow amounts will be limited to below one to two inches. Expect some minor travel impacts as a result of the light snow over the next few days. Temperatures will be below normal through mid-week with highs below freezing in many locations Wednesday and lows in some valleys Thursday morning well into the single digits. Motorists should remain alert to rapidly changing weather, and take necessary precautions if travel is necessary. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
